Subject: Using rtNEAT with Torque...

Hi, I'm new to this group. 
I am an Irish games development student interes=
ted in AI, and I am 
currently working on a fairly ambitious project using =
the Torque 
Shader Engine. One of the requirments of this project is quite =
a 
strong AI Module.
I had been intending to use a Neural Network for a whi=
le, and when I 
say NEAT had been used in a Torque game already, I thought =
it would 
be fairly straight forward to use it.

The rtNEAT code itself wor=
ks fine, and gives me what I'm assuming is 
the correct output. However, be=
cause NEAT doenst process per tick, it 
will freeze torque while it works, =
and then resume torque. This 
obviously wont work.

I have read the help do=
cs, and they say to look at pole2_realtime_loop
(). 
I am having difficulty=
 however with supplying the arguments for the 
realtime loop: "Population *=
pop, CartPole *thecart". They are created 
in *pole2_test_realtime(), and p=
assed to the pole2_realtime_loop, 
which works fine in the traditional impl=
ementation.

However, I need to call pole2_testrealtime from my game loop, =
and so, 
need a way to access the *pop and *thecart parameters. I have trie=
d 
declaring the Population and CartPole objects at the top of 
experiments=
.cpp, as static, extern, trying to use a get and set 
method, everything I =
can think of really, but I still cant access the 
*pop and *theCart objects=
 from my realtime loop, so I cant call 
pole2_realtimeloop() every tick.

U=
ltimately, I wont be using the pole2 experiment in my game, but I 
thought =
that would be a good place to start, instead of jumping in at 
the deep end=
 so to speak. 

I'd appreciate any help on this matter, thanks,
Jack.
